thread.title: Regional champion Huskies paw past host Panthers
thread.title_full: Regional champion Huskies paw past host Panthers

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Regional champion Huskies paw past host Panthers
text:
Regional champion Huskies paw past host Panthers McAuliffe, McCollett lead Medomak Valley's defensive effort By Staff | Oct 12, 2015 
Waldoboro â€” The Medomak Valley football players and coaches knew full well it would have its hands full on Saturday, Oct. 10 as unbeaten Maine Central Institute of Pittsfield converged for a high school gridiron showdown. 
The Huskies, who lost in the state Class D title game last year, are unbeaten on the season and remained so through Saturday's game as they prowled to a 41-0 shutout over the host Panthers. 
Medomak Valley was led defensively by Nick McAuliffe with nine tackles and a quarterback sack, while Riley McCollett had eight tackles, but that is where the positive statistics ended for the Panthers as the Huskies had a monster day on offense. 
Greg Vigue threw for 225 yards and four touchdowns, while he also ran in a 28-yard touchdown in the win for MCI. 
Three of Vigue's four TD tosses went to Dillon Fitts, who caught scoring passes of 40, 44 and 70 yards. Josh Buker also caught a 25-yard scoring pass from Vigue and cashed in on the ground from 10 yards. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Crabtree Point Standings for Class D North, Medomak Valley (4-2, 109.8818 points) is fifth, while MCI (6-0, 150.0000 points) is first in the 12-team region. 
Medomak Valley, along with Camden Hills and Ellsworth/Sumner, are ineligible for postseason play due to those teams playing in lower classes than their enrollements dictate. The Windjammers have canceled the rest of their schedule this fall. 
The Panthers are in their first year of varsity play.
